text: hi good morning I'm judian and this is
doing English today I got a very good
question from Kasha and she asked how
much time do I need to spend every day
to learn
[Music]
[Applause]
English so how much time do you need to
spend every day to learn English it's a
very good question but it's a little bit
of a difficult question to answer
because it's kind of like the question
how long is a piece of
string it's as long as you want it to be
but another way it really depends on
your goals your schedule how much time
you have and how fast you want to
improve and how much you want to improve
and by when so really you have to be
very clear on your goals and this is
something that I talk about a lot in the
doing English daily newslet letter and
in a lot of detail in doing English plus
but the more specific you are about your
goals what you want to achieve and by
when the easier it will be to work out
how much time you need to spend everyday
learning
English this said here is my kind of
general advice and this is something
that I do myself with language learning
workout out how much time you have each
day to learn
English then divide that into
four spend one quarter of your time
studying English that is really focused
intense study it could be using a
grammar book or a textbook or studying
vocabulary or audio lessons or anything
it doesn't matter however you do it but
a quarter 25% of your time should be
very focused very intense study and then
for the other three quarters the other
75% of the time just use English in
whatever way you can read books in
English read articles on the internet in
English read
magazines um watch tv shows watch
YouTube videos listen to podcasts listen
to audio books anything it doesn't
really matter whatever you can do to
just be using
English and unlike your study time try
and make this very relaxed this is not
about you kind of focusing and really
studying this is about you enjoying
using English and just getting as much
kind of exposure to English as you can
so it's kind of a 25 75% balance 25%
very focused very intense study followed
by 75% of your time just very relaxed
enjoying using English um in whatever
way you can yeah you could be speaking
to people talking to friends talking to
people on the internet on Facebook or
you know listening to the radio or
whatever it doesn't matter
[Music]
[Music]
don't forget if you haven't already you
